It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the HW, any value can be used for the bit-fields. Shadow register.

register.description: The register configures the attributes of the viwrite back pipeline. Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Determines the number of idles between requests on the L3 interconnect. It is only used when the write-back pipeline does data transfer from memory to memory. When the output of an overlay is stored in memory through the write-back pipeline in capture mode, the bit-field IDLENUMBER is ignored since a timing generator is used to time the transfer. The number of IDLE cycles is IDLENUMBER (from 0 to 15) if IDLESIZE=0. The number of IDLE cycles is IDLENUMBERx8 (from 0 to 120) if IDLESIZE=1 and BURSTSIZE=2. The number of IDLE cycles is IDLENUMBERx4 (from 0 to 60) if IDLESIZE=1 and BURSTSIZE=1. The number of IDLE cycles is IDLENUMBERx2 (from 0 to 30) if IDLESIZE=1 and BURSTSIZE=0.
Determines if the IDLENUMBER corresponds to a number of bursts or singles.

bitenum.description: The number of idles between requests is defined by IDLENUMBER as number of cycles.
The number of idles between requests is defined by IDLENUMBER multiplied by burst size as number of cycles.

bitfield.description: Defines the frame rate capture.

bitenum.description: Only one out of six frames is captured. The first one is captured then the second one is skipped and so on.
Only one frame is captured.
Only one out of seven frames is captured. The first one is captured then the second one is skipped and so on.
All frames are captures until the write-back channel is disabled or there is no more data generated by the overlay or the pipeline attached to the write-back channel.
Only one out of two frames is captured. The first one is captured then the second one is skipped and so on.
Only one out of four frames is captured. The first one is captured then the second one is skipped and so on.
Only one out of five frames is captured. The first one is captured then the second one is skipped and so on.
Only one out of three frames is captured. The first one is captured then the second one is skipped and so on.

bitfield.description: Determines the priority of the write-back pipeline. The write-back pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline. The arbitration gives always the priority first to the high priority pipelines using round-robin between them. When there is only normal priority pipelines sending requests, the round-robin applies between them.

bitenum.description: The write-back pipeline is one of the normal priority pipeline.
The write-back pipeline is one of the high priority pipeline.

bitfield.description: Determines if the stride for CbCr buffer is the 1x or 2x of the Y buffer stride. It is only used in case of YUV420 and 2D access

bitenum.description: The CbCr stride value is equal to the Y stride.
The CbCr stride value is double to the Y stride.

bitfield.description: Video Vertical Resize Tap Number

bitenum.description: 3 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic. The 2 other taps are not used.
5 taps are used for the vertical filtering logic.

bitfield.description: When connected to the overlay output of a channel the write back can operate as a simple transfer from memory to memory (composition engine) or as a capture channel.

bitenum.description: Capture mode (default mode
Memory to memory mode

bitfield.description: WB Channel In configuration wr: immediate

bitenum.description: OVR1 (VP1)

bitfield.description: Color Space Conversion full range setting.

bitenum.description: Limited range selected: 16 subtracted from Y before color space conversion
Full range selected: Y is not modified before the color space conversion

bitfield.description: Enable the color space conversion. The HW does not enable/disable the conversion based on the pixel format. The bit-field shall be reset when the format is not YUV.

bitenum.description: Disable Color Space Conversion RGB to YUV
Enable Color Space Conversion RGB to YUV

bitfield.description: Premultiplied alpha enable

bitenum.description: disabled.Disabled. This bit also disable the logic present in the associated channel out that compute the alpha component sent to the WB pipe

bitfield.description: Resize Enable

bitenum.description: Disable the resize processing
Enable the horizontal resize processing
Enable both horizontal and vertical resize processing
Enable the vertical resize processing

bitfield.description: Write-back Format. It defines the pixel format when storing the write-back picture into memory.

bitenum.description: RGB24-888 (24-bit container)
UYVY 4:2:2 co-sited
YUV2 4:2:2 co-sited
NV12/NV21 4:2:0 2 buffers (Y + UV)
xRGB32-8888 (32-bit container)
RGBx32-8888 (24-bit RGB aligned on MSB of the 32-bit container)

bitfield.description: Write-back Enable. wr: immediate

bitenum.description: Write-back disabled
Write-back enabled

register.description: The register set the WB pipe. Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Number of OCP TAGS to be used for the pipeline (from 1 to 32)
Enable region-based mechanism for WBPipe
OCP requests corresponds to pipeline data are secure/unsecure. The bit-field can be modified only by secure transaction using MReqSecure qualifier.
Field Sequential Color generation : R,G, and B buffers are generated from RGB buffer.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the WB buffer (DISPC_WB_BA__0 DISPC_WB_BA__1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_WB_BA__0 is used). Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Write-back base address Base address of the WB buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV422, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV420, byte alignment is supported)). It case of YUV 4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the WB buffer (DISPC_WB_BA__0 DISPC_WB_BA__1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity otherwise only DISPC_WB_BA__0 is used). Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Write-back base address Base address of the WB buffer (aligned on pixel size boundary except in case of RGB24 packed format, 4-pixel alignment is required; in case of YUV422, 2-pixel alignment is required, and YUV420, byte alignment is supported)). It case of YUV 4:2:0 format, it indicates the base address of the Y buffer. When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the UV buffer for the write-back pipeline. (DISPC_WB_BA_UV_0 and DISPC_WB_BA_UV_1 for ping-pong mechanism with external trigger, based on the field polarity, otherwise only DISPC_WB_BA_UV_0 is used)). The register is also used to configure the RGB plane BA for RGB565A8 format. Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Video base address alinged on 16-bit boundary Base address of the UV video buffer used only in case of YUV420-NV12 When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The register configures the base address of the UV buffer for the write-back pipeline. The register is also used to configure the RGB plane BA for RGB565A8 format. Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Video base address alinged on 16-bit boundary Base address of the UV video buffer used only in case of YUV420-NV12 When the TILER is addressed, the bits: [28:27] = 0x0 for 8-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x1 for 16-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x2 for 32-bit tiled [28:27] = 0x3 for page mode [31:29] = 0x0 for 0-degree view [31:29] = 0x1 for 180-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x2 for 0-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x3 for 180-degree view [31:29] = 0x4 for 270-degree view + mirroring [31:29] = 0x5 for 270-degree view [31:29] = 0x6 for 90-degree view [31:29] = 0x7 for 90-degree view + mirroring Otherwise the bits indicated the corresponding bit address to access the SDRAM.

register.description: The bank of registers configure the up/down-scaling coefficients for the horizontal resize of the video picture associated with the write back pipeline for the phases from 0 to 15. It is used for Crb and Cr setting. It is used only when the pixel format at the input of the filter is one of the YUV formats. If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the HW, any value can be used for the bit-fields. Shadow register.

If the pixel format at the input of the filter is ARGB (all ARGB, RGB, RGBA are converted to ARGB32-8888 by the color space conversion before going to the filter is the color space conversion is done before the filter). When the register is not used by the HW, any value can be used for the bit-fields. Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Signed coefficient C2 for the vertical up/down-scaling with the phase n
Signed coefficient C1 for the vertical up/down-scaling with the phase n

register.description: This register allows to mask/unmask the module internal sources of interrupt, on an event-by-event basis

bitfield.description: Write-back synced (configuration copied from shadow to work)

bitenum.description: WBBufferOverflow is masked
WBBufferOverflow generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: For Write-back region-based, event indicating end of current window

bitenum.description: WBBufferOverflow is masked
WBBufferOverflow generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: Write-back Frame Done.

bitenum.description: WBBufferOverflow is masked
WBBufferOverflow generates an interrupt when it occurs

bitfield.description: The write back buffer has been flushed before been fully drained. Enable

bitenum.description: Interrupt is masked
Interrupt is enabled

bitfield.description: Write-back DMA Buffer Overflow. The DMA buffer is full

bitenum.description: WBBufferOverflow is masked
WBBufferOverflow generates an interrupt when it occurs

register.description: This register regroups all the status of the module internal events that generate an interrupt. Write 1 to a given bit resets this bit

bitfield.description: Write-back synced (configuration copied from shadow to work)

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Write-back Frame Done.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Write-back Frame Done.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

bitfield.description: Write back DMA buffer is flushed before been completely drained.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (Pending) WRITE: Status bit is reset

bitfield.description: Write-back DMA Buffer Overrflow. The DMA buffer is full.

bitenum.description: READS: Event is false. WRITES: Status bit unchanged.
READS: Event is true (pending). WRITES: Status bit is reset.

register.description: The register configures the size of the write-back picture associated with the write back pipeline after up/down-scaling (size of the image stored in DDR memory, generated by WB pipe). Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Number of lines of the wb picture in memory Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the picture store in memory (program to value minus one).

Number of pixels of the wb picture in memory. Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixels of the picture stored in memory (program to value minus one). In case of 32-bit RGB/ARGB/RGBA pixel formats and 2D burst, the maximum width is limited to 2048 pixels.

register.description: The register configures the size of the output of overlay connected to the write-back pipeline when the overlay output is only used by the write-back pipeline. When the overlay is output on the VP1 output, the size of the frame is defined in the register. Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Number of lines of the Write-back picture Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the write-back picture from overlay or pipeline.
Number of pixels of the Write-back picture Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of pixels of the write-back picture from overlay or pipeline..

register.description: The register configures the start position of the window on overlay which wb will capture Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Y position of the video window Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the Y position of the video window #1 .The line at the top has the Y-position 0.
X position of the video window Encoded value (from 0 to 4095) to specify the X position of the video window #1. The first pixel on the left of the display screen has the X-position 0.

register.description: The register configures the total sizey (total number of lines) of all the windows written back to the memory in Write-Back Region-based mode. Shadow register.

bitfield.description: Total number of lines of the Write-back picture in Region-based mode Encoded value (from 1 to 4096) to specify the number of lines of the write-back picture from overlay or pipeline.
